In the future we envision an upgrade to our Particl Copay App that will add Cold Staking support. That will allow us to take advantage of the wallet’s excellent multi-signature support and enable a whole host of new security benefits, including but not limited to:

  • cold staking with multi-signature (ie. your “staking node” will stake but to spend funds you will need m-of-n signatures
  • integration with hardware devices (like Ledger or Trezor) for key signing (providing the utmost level of security when combined with multi-signature and cold staking).

Brief statement about tomorrow’s hardfork

As the hardfork cometh at midnight, we’re going to let everyone continue to upgrade and track the health of the blockchain for around 12–24 hours. We know everyone is anxious to build their Cold Staking contract but what is most important is ensuring the blockchain and all PART are secure.

The GUI is getting waxed and buffed for tomorrow’s debut and we’re also preparing some guides for the GUI so people can walk through setting up your cold staking contracts.

Thank you

Particl Team

children.value: In Particl your public key isn’t (initially) made public. While you share your Particl address with others so that they can send you coins, your Particl address is only a hash of your public key, not the public key itself.

A hash function is a one-way cryptographic function that takes an input and turns it into a cryptographic output. By one-way I mean that you can’t derive the input from the output. It’s kind of like encrypting something then losing the key.
What does that mean in English?
All of that is a complicated way of saying that while an attacker with a quantum computer could derive the private key from the public key,
they couldn’t derive the public key from the Particl address since the public key was run through multiple quantum-resistant one-way hash functions.
So how does this all fit together?
The cold staking feature consists of several key components:
your “wallet” with your coins (much like today) and
a “cold staking script” — this is like the script in bitcoin or smart contracts on other alts

Once activated your staking node signs transactions with its private key, thus your real public key for your actual PART tokens is never exposed onto the blockchain, until you actually spend them, in which case the change always goes into a new address where the public key is not known.
Again, cold staking consists of the following components — your
What is the cold staking script?
It is essentially a smart contract that says
`if this is a cold staking transaction, then allow the private key from the staking node to sign the transaction; otherwise the private key from the wallet is required.`
Let’s walk through the process of setting cold staking up

1First step is to setup a new “staking node”. A staking node is a full blockchain node which has been configured to stake on behalf of your “wallet” (aka it has been delegated staking power over your wallet). This can be a dedicated server, cloud or virtual server, Raspberry Pi3+ or Rock64 etc.
It is important to note that CPU
matter when staking, so do not expect to get the same results from a earlier Pi vs the new generation Pi3s etc.
Once the node is setup and in sync, go ahead and create a new wallet, then generate a staking node public key (keep a note of this as you will need it in the next step).
**We have prepared tools which will automate all these steps for you. These will be made available after the hardfork has happened and the Particl blockchain is deemed secure.**
2Now, lets go back to your “wallet” on your desktop and click on “Activate Cold Staking”. You will be prompted for the staking node public key (from step 1). Enter this and click activate.
So what exactly did we just do?
config which includes the public key for the
to whom you have delegated staking powers to.

Second, you have instructed your client that the next time it creates a block from staking (leave the current wallet running until the cold staking progress bar shows 100%), it should send the outputs back to itself (just like PoS currently does) but these outputs will be part of the
Third, the next time you spend any Particl from your
the client will also automatically include the
— from thereon. Once the Cold Staking progress bar reaches 100% activation your
you setup in Step 1 will now stake securely for you without risking any of the PART in your wallet.
It is important to understand that along with this new “coin staking script” smart contract, we have also introduced an important consensus rule that applies to cold staking:
if this is a cold staking transaction then output value must go back to the same address with the same minimum value as the input
In short, what this means is
“If I staked 1,000 PART from my Par7ZFotVucq9EyXN6wRNGFwiZGHVN8Xq7 address
1,000 PART must go back to the same address”
for this to be considered a valid cold staking transaction.
This is important as it ensures that the staking node only has power to stake your coins and not spend them.
It is also worth noting here that any value

than the input value, aka the reward for staking + block fees, are manageable by the staking node. So in theory you could — as part of cold staking — send your staked coins back to your wallet address (as per consensus) and send the stake reward to a different address.
This flexibility at the protocol consensus level pave the road for several new features in the future such as:
donating staking rewards to other causes
sending staking rewards to exchange to provide liquidity
The cold staking protocol is agnostic, so that it works with all public balances (anon and blind cannot stake) including those protected by multi-signature addresses.

In the future we envision an upgrade to our Particl Copay App that will add Cold Staking support. That will allow us to take advantage of the wallet’s excellent multi-signature support and enable a whole host of new security benefits, including but not limited to:
cold staking with multi-signature (ie. your “staking node” will stake but to spend funds you will need m-of-n signatures
integration with hardware devices (like Ledger or Trezor) for key signing (providing the utmost level of security when combined with multi-signature and cold staking).

As the hardfork cometh at midnight, we’re going to let everyone continue to upgrade and track the health of the blockchain for around 12–24 hours. We know everyone is anxious to build their Cold Staking contract but what is most important is ensuring the blockchain and all PART are secure.
The GUI is getting waxed and buffed for tomorrow’s debut and we’re also preparing some guides for the GUI so people can walk through setting up your cold staking contracts.

node.plaintext:
Don’t worry, this is a scheduled protocol change, we just don’t want you to
miss out!
Upgrade to Particl Core 0.15.0.2 or newer before Friday!
Scheduled Hardfork of the Particl Protocol
When we upgraded
[https://particl.news/release-particl-core-0-15-0-2-2bcaddccbfcf] Particl Core
to be in step with Bitcoin (release 0.15.0.1) development we also locked in
Particl’s first planned hardfork to happen November 10th of this year.

> 
This Friday, Cold Staking will be activated on mainnet meaning it has graduated
from the testing environment (testnet) into the arms of every user working on
the network!

Don’t be left behind! You may be one of these nodes still running old protocol.
Please verify right now if you’re on the latest Particl Core protocol, or at
least release 0.15.0.2 so your wallet is upgraded for the hardfork changes on
Friday. Doing this now will eliminate all stress and anxiousness on whether your
PART tokens are traveling on the correct ledger or the expired ledger after Nov.
10th.

Official Downloads: Particl Core 0.15.0.3
particl/particl-core [https://github.com/particl/particl-core/releases]
particl-core - Particl Core integration/staging tree
[https://github.com/particl/particl-core/releases]github.com
[https://github.com/particl/particl-core/releases]


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

FAQs
What is Cold Staking and why is this hardfork important?
Our friend and contributor Crypto Guard [https://medium.com/u/2be55e0c3a02] 
released a great article on Decentralized Today yesterday giving a great
overview of Cold Staking and Quantum Resistance. Please make some time to read
this for a better understanding of what the Particl Development Team is bringing
to #cryptocurrency [https://paper.dropbox.com/?q=%23cryptocurrency] and 
#proofofstake [https://paper.dropbox.com/?q=%23proofofstake] systems.

Particl’s 10th of November Hardfork: Cold Staking & Quantum Resistance
[https://decentralize.today/particls-10th-of-november-hardfork-cold-staking-quantum-resistance-a083ef3913cc]
Particl, a decentralized privacy platform and cryptocurrency, is just about to
go through its first hardfork on the…
[https://decentralize.today/particls-10th-of-november-hardfork-cold-staking-quantum-resistance-a083ef3913cc]
decentralize.today
[https://decentralize.today/particls-10th-of-november-hardfork-cold-staking-quantum-resistance-a083ef3913cc]

Will there be 2 copies of PART after the hardfork, like Bitcoin and Bitcoin Cash
or Ethereum and Ethereum Classic?
No. Your PART tokens remain the same as they are right now, on the same original
chain and in the same wallet. The hardfork will split the ledger (blockchain) on
Nov. 10th and stakers working on the network

What happens if I don’t upgrade my wallet in time?
Once Cold Staking gets activated on the blockchain all old wallets not on latest
protocol will begin producing a majority of orphaned blocks, transaction times
will slow to a crawl and worst of all, PART sent from old wallets will not be
validated by new wallets.

So if you try to send PART from an old wallet to Bittrex for example, Bittrex
will never get it because you are not on the correct blockchain.

Are PART I send from an old wallet after the hardfork lost forever?
No. Remember, that wallet is broadcasting to an expired blockchain. They’ll be
lost forever on that chain but they haven’t been audited in the correct PART
blockchain so you still own them.

Once you upgrade your wallet to Particl Core 0.15.0.2 or newer you’ll have your
correct PART in your wallet and free to send them with the assurance they’ll be
registered on the blockchain and with services like Bittrex.

Tell all your friends!
Particl Hardfork, Cold Staking and Quantum Resistance
[http://www.nasdaq.com/article/quantum-computing-and-building-resistance-into-proof-of-stake-cm863848] 
(1st for PoS token!) are coming November 10th, 2017.

coinmarketcal.com

Thank you
Particl Team
node.html:
Don’t worry, this is a scheduled protocol change, we just don’t want you to miss out!

Upgrade to Particl Core 0.15.0.2 or newer before Friday!

Scheduled Hardfork of the Particl Protocol

When we upgraded Particl Core to be in step with Bitcoin (release 0.15.0.1) development we also locked in Particl’s first planned hardfork to happen November 10th of this year.

This Friday, Cold Staking will be activated on mainnet meaning it has graduated from the testing environment (testnet) into the arms of every user working on the network!

Don’t be left behind! You may be one of these nodes still running old protocol.

Please verify right now if you’re on the latest Particl Core protocol, or at least release 0.15.0.2 so your wallet is upgraded for the hardfork changes on Friday. Doing this now will eliminate all stress and anxiousness on whether your PART tokens are traveling on the correct ledger or the expired ledger after Nov. 10th.

Official Downloads: Particl Core 0.15.0.3

particl/particl-core
particl-core - Particl Core integration/staging treegithub.com

FAQs

What is Cold Staking and why is this hardfork important?

Our friend and contributor Crypto Guard released a great article on Decentralized Today yesterday giving a great overview of Cold Staking and Quantum Resistance. Please make some time to read this for a better understanding of what the Particl Development Team is bringing to #cryptocurrency and #proofofstake systems.

Particl’s 10th of November Hardfork: Cold Staking & Quantum Resistance
Particl, a decentralized privacy platform and cryptocurrency, is just about to go through its first hardfork on the…decentralize.today

Will there be 2 copies of PART after the hardfork, like Bitcoin and Bitcoin Cash or Ethereum and Ethereum Classic?

No. Your PART tokens remain the same as they are right now, on the same original chain and in the same wallet. The hardfork will split the ledger (blockchain) on Nov. 10th and stakers working on the network

What happens if I don’t upgrade my wallet in time?

Once Cold Staking gets activated on the blockchain all old wallets not on latest protocol will begin producing a majority of orphaned blocks, transaction times will slow to a crawl and worst of all, PART sent from old wallets will not be validated by new wallets.

So if you try to send PART from an old wallet to Bittrex for example, Bittrex will never get it because you are not on the correct blockchain.

Are PART I send from an old wallet after the hardfork lost forever?

No. Remember, that wallet is broadcasting to an expired blockchain. They’ll be lost forever on that chain but they haven’t been audited in the correct PART blockchain so you still own them.

Once you upgrade your wallet to Particl Core 0.15.0.2 or newer you’ll have your correct PART in your wallet and free to send them with the assurance they’ll be registered on the blockchain and with services like Bittrex.

Tell all your friends!

Particl Hardfork, Cold Staking and Quantum Resistance (1st for PoS token!) are coming November 10th, 2017.

CryptoCurrency Calendar
A free collaborative calendar for all upcoming crypto events. Evidence-based & Community-driven.coinmarketcal.com

Thank you

Particl Team

node.plaintext:
Join our community of testers ready the Particl Project’s newest intuitive,
responsive UI.
Yesterday the Particl Development Team released version 0.1.0
[https://github.com/particl/partgui/releases/tag/v0.1.0] of our newest user
interface, Particl Wallet; for immediate testing on PART Testnet. Built with
Electron and Angular, this GUI will constantly be adapting to the Particl
framework for applications, widgets, communication tools and more. All open
source, all decentralized, all private.

Particl Wallet is the fourth wallet built by Particl for PART users and the 2nd
unique wallet released this month! Our Copay Wallet is available on the Google
App Store [https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=io.particl.copay] and
an overview of all Particl clients can be found on our Wiki.

particl-clients * Particl.wiki [https://particl.wiki/particl-clients]
In this location all the essential files of your wallet and Particl blockchain
are stored. Let's have a look at them… [https://particl.wiki/particl-clients]
particl.wiki [https://particl.wiki/particl-clients]

As decentralized applications (DApps) our built on the Particl Privacy
Framework, like our upcoming Marketplace, they will plug into the Particl
Wallet. Imagined as plug-and-play elements, these privacy apps, widgets and
add-ons are controlled by each user depending on how they interact with
Particl’s decentralized privacy platform.

Keep it simple, stupid
Responsibility in product release integrity is of upmost importance when dealing
with the security of other people’s experience and finances so all initial
official builds will be hardcoded for use with the Particl Testnet only. As
always, our code is open source and Particl Wallet can be used on Particl
Mainnet by advanced users who compile their own releases.

Testers Wanted!
The quicker we find and fix bugs the faster we release an official mainnet-ready
build. Anyone can test and report bugs. Building Particl Wallet with tools like
Electron provides us a truly easy built-in application installer and launcher.
One click and the program summons the daemon to access the PART Blockchain.
Users are reporting that the latest Particl Core greatly increases the
blockchain sync time, making Particl Wallet one of the fastest and easiest to
get started with in the crypto space!

Particl Wallet on Github
The Particl Wallet currently uses the daemon from Particl Core v0.15.0.2
[https://github.com/particl/particl-core/releases/tag/v0.15.0.2].
It will automatically download and run it.

Anyone who joined us in a previous testnet will either have to remove their
testnet/blocks and testnet/chainstate folder, or run the gui using ./particl
-reindex

particl/partgui [https://github.com/particl/partgui]
partgui - Particl Angular GUI - The source for the Particl GUI.
[https://github.com/particl/partgui]github.com
[https://github.com/particl/partgui]

Thank You
Particl Team

Particl Wallet is the fourth wallet built by Particl for PART users and the 2nd unique wallet released this month! Our Copay Wallet is available on the
and an overview of all Particl clients can be found on our Wiki.
In this location all the essential files of your wallet and Particl blockchain are stored. Let's have a look at them…

As decentralized applications (DApps) our built on the Particl Privacy Framework, like our upcoming Marketplace, they will plug into the Particl Wallet. Imagined as plug-and-play elements, these privacy apps, widgets and add-ons are controlled by each user depending on how they interact with Particl’s decentralized privacy platform.

Responsibility in product release integrity is of upmost importance when dealing with the security of other people’s experience and finances so all initial official builds will be hardcoded for use with the Particl Testnet only. As always, our code is open source and Particl Wallet can be used on Particl Mainnet by advanced users who compile their own releases.

The quicker we find and fix bugs the faster we release an official mainnet-ready build. Anyone can test and report bugs. Building Particl Wallet with tools like Electron provides us a truly easy built-in application installer and launcher. One click and the program summons the daemon to access the PART Blockchain. Users are reporting that the latest Particl Core greatly increases the blockchain sync time,
making Particl Wallet one of the fastest and easiest to get started with in the crypto space!
The Particl Wallet currently uses the daemon from
It will automatically download and run it.
Anyone who joined us in a previous testnet will either have to remove their testnet/blocks and testnet/chainstate folder, or run the gui using ./particl -reindex

node.plaintext:
.Building on a strong foundation.
Particl’s first 100+ days since our seed round has seen the creation of the
Particl Foundation, a pure Proof of Stake blockchain flexible enough for 2nd
layer integrations (Lightning Network, Rootstock) and the successful launch of
our privacy token PART; the first token built on Bitcoin 0.14.2 that can claim:

 * Pure PoS(v3) (non-hybrid PoW/PoS)
 * Native SegWit (all transactions are SegWit)
 * Confidential Transactions (hidden amounts)
 * Decentralized Voting (Governance)
 * Testnet | RingCT (hidden amounts and address identities)
 * Testnet | Cold Staking

Development Process
Roadmaps are tentative, working documents, subject to revision. These documents
are important in parsing out non-goals or long term goals that, in our case,
shouldn’t tie up production on the MVP.

 * They will be released with version numbers.
 * Updates will be published as required.
 * The team will continue to add new talent
 * Some components are prerequisite for completing others, which can affect
   roadmap completion

The release sequence of items within a quarter is interchangeable. For example,
if the wallet app gets sign-off before we finalize outside partnerships it will
be released regardless of it’s place on the image.


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Particl will be integrating 3rd Party apps regularly throughout the next 2–1/2
quarters. Imran, our Commercial & Partner Strategist is putting the closing
touches on a number of partner integrations aimed to expand the usability of the
PART token.

Steady development is happening on the Electron App. Follow it on Github or
build it yourself to keep track of progress.

particl/partgui [https://github.com/particl/partgui/commits/master]
partgui - Particl Angular GUI - The source for the Particl GUI.
[https://github.com/particl/partgui/commits/master]github.com
[https://github.com/particl/partgui/commits/master]


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Already being tested on TESTNET6
[https://particl.news/weve-reset-the-testbed-today-testnet6-is-now-live-69e1c45b4f42]
, Cold Staking is the concept of “defining a node which has the sole power to
only stake.” The result is a more secure ability to stake while using
multi-signature addresses.

Cold Staking will bring protocol changes that, when launched on mainnet, will
make it the first planned hard fork on the Particl blockchain.

Creating the Particl Market is the prime goal of this Roadmap. This is the
decentralized marketplace Minimal Viable Product (MVP) everyone is most excited
for. Alpha will be well designed and bring major protocol changes.

RingCT on mainnet, the audit of Particl Core (including RingCT) and our
university Research Grant all will likely fall into Q4 as well. This is a good
example of versioning on our roadmap. Version 1.1 will get to a point it is no
longer useful, at which time we will update it to better reflect real-time
activity on the project. RingCT, for example, will be a planned hardfork on
Particl blockchain so releasing it with other Q4 protocol changes will be
considered by the team.

When we launched the Particl blockchain, 996,000 PART tokens were created and
time locked in a multi-sig address* that was reserved for our Primary funding
round. Delivering the decentralized marketplace MVP is a requirement before
these tokens can be made available.

Below are both explorers displaying this address. The insight explorer will show
the PART as available after midnight, November 30th, 2017. The CryptoID explorer
shows the full count of PART (996k) but the distribution is “unconfirmed” until
unlocked (17.11.30).

> *This is the largest PART address representing ~11% uncirculated PART.
https://explorer.particl.io/address/RNnoeeqBTkpPQH8d29Gf45dszVj9RtbmCu
https://chainz.cryptoid.info/part/address.dws?RNnoeeqBTkpPQH8d29Gf45dszVj9RtbmCu.htm
Our Primary Round and “Beta” marketplace both fall in Q1/2018. These are
parallel tracks and are unrelated to each other. The project is well funded.

The differences between Alpha and Beta are expected to be trivial, mainly bug
patching, as no significant software features will be added to the Beta release.
It is important to keep in mind Alpha/Beta are minimally viable products that
prototype features. These releases will be well done and give buyers and sellers
a solid and secure platform to transact with each other.


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Status Reporting
In our previous communication we talked about more detailed development updates.
Henk, our Project Manager has been working with the web developers to create a
new page on Particl.io [https://particl.io] that provides a breakdown of what
the team is working on, what’s in review and what is coming up at any given
time.

When this page is live we’ll announce it to the community and can have an email
signup button for users who want to be notified on status updates.

Conclusion
Believing to the core that a strong foundation must be laid before a privacy
platform can properly be built has been the Particl team’s Modus operandi since
we began. Starting with the choice to build open source, on the latest robust
Bitcoin codebase w/SegWit, to a “multi-state” PART token (public, blind, anon)
and finally the underlying privacy cryptography enhancements in Confidential
Transactions and RingCT, every step in Particl’s early existence has been
calculated.

Particl Project [https://github.com/particl]
GitHub is where people build software. More than 23 million people use GitHub
to
discover, fork, and contribute to over… [https://github.com/particl]github.com
[https://github.com/particl]

Particl is open source. Our Github is a great place for community developers to
get involved. The team works in the open and is welcoming to users who want to 
help [https://particl.io/careers].

https://particl.io/roadmap/

— Particl Team
node.html:
Building on a strong foundation.

Particl’s first 100+ days since our seed round has seen the creation of the Particl Foundation, a pure Proof of Stake blockchain flexible enough for 2nd layer integrations (Lightning Network, Rootstock) and the successful launch of our privacy token PART; the first token built on Bitcoin 0.14.2 that can claim:

  • Pure PoS(v3) (non-hybrid PoW/PoS)
  • Native SegWit (all transactions are SegWit)
  • Confidential Transactions (hidden amounts)
  • Decentralized Voting (Governance)
  • Testnet | RingCT (hidden amounts and address identities)
  • Testnet | Cold Staking

Development Process

Roadmaps are tentative, working documents, subject to revision. These documents are important in parsing out non-goals or long term goals that, in our case, shouldn’t tie up production on the MVP.

  • They will be released with version numbers.
  • Updates will be published as required.
  • The team will continue to add new talent
  • Some components are prerequisite for completing others, which can affect roadmap completion

The release sequence of items within a quarter is interchangeable. For example, if the wallet app gets sign-off before we finalize outside partnerships it will be released regardless of it’s place on the image.

Particl will be integrating 3rd Party apps regularly throughout the next 2–1/2 quarters. Imran, our Commercial & Partner Strategist is putting the closing touches on a number of partner integrations aimed to expand the usability of the PART token.

Steady development is happening on the Electron App. Follow it on Github or build it yourself to keep track of progress.

particl/partgui
partgui - Particl Angular GUI - The source for the Particl GUI.github.com

Already being tested on TESTNET6, Cold Staking is the concept of “defining a node which has the sole power to only stake.” The result is a more secure ability to stake while using multi-signature addresses.

Cold Staking will bring protocol changes that, when launched on mainnet, will make it the first planned hard fork on the Particl blockchain.

Creating the Particl Market is the prime goal of this Roadmap. This is the decentralized marketplace Minimal Viable Product (MVP) everyone is most excited for. Alpha will be well designed and bring major protocol changes.

RingCT on mainnet, the audit of Particl Core (including RingCT) and our university Research Grant all will likely fall into Q4 as well. This is a good example of versioning on our roadmap. Version 1.1 will get to a point it is no longer useful, at which time we will update it to better reflect real-time activity on the project. RingCT, for example, will be a planned hardfork on Particl blockchain so releasing it with other Q4 protocol changes will be considered by the team.

When we launched the Particl blockchain, 996,000 PART tokens were created and time locked in a multi-sig address* that was reserved for our Primary funding round. Delivering the decentralized marketplace MVP is a requirement before these tokens can be made available.

Below are both explorers displaying this address. The insight explorer will show the PART as available after midnight, November 30th, 2017. The CryptoID explorer shows the full count of PART (996k) but the distribution is “unconfirmed” until unlocked (17.11.30).

*This is the largest PART address representing ~11% uncirculated PART.

Our Primary Round and “Beta” marketplace both fall in Q1/2018. These are parallel tracks and are unrelated to each other. The project is well funded.

The differences between Alpha and Beta are expected to be trivial, mainly bug patching, as no significant software features will be added to the Beta release. It is important to keep in mind Alpha/Beta are minimally viable products that prototype features. These releases will be well done and give buyers and sellers a solid and secure platform to transact with each other.

Status Reporting

In our previous communication we talked about more detailed development updates. Henk, our Project Manager has been working with the web developers to create a new page on Particl.io that provides a breakdown of what the team is working on, what’s in review and what is coming up at any given time.

When this page is live we’ll announce it to the community and can have an email signup button for users who want to be notified on status updates.

Conclusion

Believing to the core that a strong foundation must be laid before a privacy platform can properly be built has been the Particl team’s Modus operandi since we began. Starting with the choice to build open source, on the latest robust Bitcoin codebase w/SegWit, to a “multi-state” PART token (public, blind, anon) and finally the underlying privacy cryptography enhancements in Confidential Transactions and RingCT, every step in Particl’s early existence has been calculated.

Particl Project
GitHub is where people build software. More than 23 million people use GitHub to discover, fork, and contribute to over…github.com

Particl is open source. Our Github is a great place for community developers to get involved. The team works in the open and is welcoming to users who want to help.

https://particl.io/roadmap/

— Particl Team

node.plaintext:
The Swiss Foundation Supervisory Authority has approved the legal structure of
the Particl Foundation and its funding structure.
> The foundation and its board will strictly function as an entity with the
mission of providing funding and support for the Particl ecosystem, the
continued development of the Particl network and academic, non-profit &
for-profit development of enhancements for the Particl platform and privacy
domain. The foundation will not govern nor make choices for the network itself,
as the network will be governed in a decentralized manner by the native voting
system directed by the network token holders themselves.
This long-awaited regulatory approval means the team is finalizing preparations
for Mainnet launch, PART distribution and Proof of Stake network
stability/security measures.

Particl Foundation —LinkedIn [https://www.linkedin.com/company-beta/24778523/]
node.html:
The Swiss Foundation Supervisory Authority has approved the legal structure of the Particl Foundation and its funding structure.

The foundation and its board will strictly function as an entity with the mission of providing funding and support for the Particl ecosystem, the continued development of the Particl network and academic, non-profit & for-profit development of enhancements for the Particl platform and privacy domain. The foundation will not govern nor make choices for the network itself, as the network will be governed in a decentralized manner by the native voting system directed by the network token holders themselves.

This long-awaited regulatory approval means the team is finalizing preparations for Mainnet launch, PART distribution and Proof of Stake network stability/security measures.

Particl Foundation — LinkedIn

node.plaintext:
We appreciate the patience the Particl community, developers, contributors and
testers have shown over the past 2 months. We know waiting for something this
exciting for this long can challenge even the most dedicated supporter.

> Unus pro omnibus, omnes pro uno (latin) — “One for all, and all for one” —
Swiss motto [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Switzerland]
In our June 6th update
[https://particl.news/project-update-june-6th-2017-eeec12500754] we pushed the
anticipated mainnet release to June 30th based on the information we had at the
time; that we would have confirmation of the foundation creation in hand early
this week. June 30th would have allowed us a few days to prepare for mainnet.
Since the team still has not received confirmation (not alarming, just busy) and
although it is very possible it could come in the next 24–72 hrs that does not
leave us enough time to prepare and give notice for mainnet. Therefore as things
stand it is very likely that there will be a delay beyond the anticipated 30th
June date. PART tokens can not be created or distributed without our Swiss
foundation in operation to oversee the process.

5 things to do while you wait for PART:
 1. Create your Particl wallet to ensure you get access to your PART on launch 
    https://particl.news/guide-how-to-generate-your-particl-exchange-passphrase-1fd78ba36fd1
 2. Join testers in our Slack with TESTNET#3 featuring RingCT: +Particl
    Testnet — Getting Started
    [https://paper.dropbox.com/doc/d9yhExvCaW6vCp3qLUwuW]
 3. Get access to your PART tokens (they’ll be testnet tokens) ahead of launch
    and play with staking, voting, donating and untraceable, unlinkable
    transactions all on top of bitcoin’s robust codebase.
 4. Join us for our 2nd team AMA hosted by the ARK community. Wednesday June
    28th, 9am PT in the #trading_altcoins channel on ARK slack.

https://ark.io/slack5. Help grow Particl’s user base ahead of launch:

 * Leverage Steemit platform/users by creating articles on Particl dev team
   bringing Confidential Transactions, RingCT, voting and governance to
   bitcoin’s codebase and how that is good for all. Tag using #particl
 * Reddit/Twitter/Bitcointalk posts that get word out about Particl’s upcoming
   privacy features, significance of privacy in anticipation of marketplace,
   significance of choice of privacy (RingCT or CT)
 * Articles on Particl staking, passive income opportunities by running a node,
   especially when marketplace starts getting used around the world.
 * Get Involved. As the project is getting closer to mainnet the team is looking
   for more community growth and participation opportunities. This could be
   helping with our social channels (twitter, reddit, etc), creating a
   development community for Particl, creating a writing community and gathering
   graphic, design orientated individuals to help with promotions, marketing and
   PR.

As we near the end of our wait I ask you to hold strong and prepare for world
domination.

Thank you,

Particl Team
node.html:
We appreciate the patience the Particl community, developers, contributors and testers have shown over the past 2 months. We know waiting for something this exciting for this long can challenge even the most dedicated supporter.

Unus pro omnibus, omnes pro uno (latin) — “One for all, and all for one” — Swiss motto

In our June 6th update we pushed the anticipated mainnet release to June 30th based on the information we had at the time; that we would have confirmation of the foundation creation in hand early this week. June 30th would have allowed us a few days to prepare for mainnet. Since the team still has not received confirmation (not alarming, just busy) and although it is very possible it could come in the next 24–72 hrs that does not leave us enough time to prepare and give notice for mainnet. Therefore as things stand it is very likely that there will be a delay beyond the anticipated 30th June date. PART tokens can not be created or distributed without our Swiss foundation in operation to oversee the process.

5 things to do while you wait for PART:

  1. Create your Particl wallet to ensure you get access to your PART on launch https://particl.news/guide-how-to-generate-your-particl-exchange-passphrase-1fd78ba36fd1
  2. Join testers in our Slack with TESTNET#3 featuring RingCT: +Particl Testnet — Getting Started
  3. Get access to your PART tokens (they’ll be testnet tokens) ahead of launch and play with staking, voting, donating and untraceable, unlinkable transactions all on top of bitcoin’s robust codebase.
  4. Join us for our 2nd team AMA hosted by the ARK community. Wednesday June 28th, 9am PT in the #trading_altcoins channel on ARK slack.

5. Help grow Particl’s user base ahead of launch:

  • Leverage Steemit platform/users by creating articles on Particl dev team bringing Confidential Transactions, RingCT, voting and governance to bitcoin’s codebase and how that is good for all. Tag using #particl
  • Reddit/Twitter/Bitcointalk posts that get word out about Particl’s upcoming privacy features, significance of privacy in anticipation of marketplace, significance of choice of privacy (RingCT or CT)
  • Articles on Particl staking, passive income opportunities by running a node, especially when marketplace starts getting used around the world.
  • Get Involved. As the project is getting closer to mainnet the team is looking for more community growth and participation opportunities. This could be helping with our social channels (twitter, reddit, etc), creating a development community for Particl, creating a writing community and gathering graphic, design orientated individuals to help with promotions, marketing and PR.

As we near the end of our wait I ask you to hold strong and prepare for world domination.

Thank you,

Particl Team

childHtmlRehype.html:
We appreciate the patience the Particl community, developers, contributors and testers have shown over the past 2 months. We know waiting for something this exciting for this long can challenge even the most dedicated supporter.

Unus pro omnibus, omnes pro uno (latin) — “One for all, and all for one” — Swiss motto

In our June 6th update we pushed the anticipated mainnet release to June 30th based on the information we had at the time; that we would have confirmation of the foundation creation in hand early this week. June 30th would have allowed us a few days to prepare for mainnet. Since the team still has not received confirmation (not alarming, just busy) and although it is very possible it could come in the next 24–72 hrs that does not leave us enough time to prepare and give notice for mainnet. Therefore as things stand it is very likely that there will be a delay beyond the anticipated 30th June date. PART tokens can not be created or distributed without our Swiss foundation in operation to oversee the process.

5 things to do while you wait for PART:

  1. Create your Particl wallet to ensure you get access to your PART on launch https://particl.news/guide-how-to-generate-your-particl-exchange-passphrase-1fd78ba36fd1
  2. Join testers in our Slack with TESTNET#3 featuring RingCT: +Particl Testnet — Getting Started
  3. Get access to your PART tokens (they’ll be testnet tokens) ahead of launch and play with staking, voting, donating and untraceable, unlinkable transactions all on top of bitcoin’s robust codebase.
  4. Join us for our 2nd team AMA hosted by the ARK community. Wednesday June 28th, 9am PT in the #trading_altcoins channel on ARK slack.

5. Help grow Particl’s user base ahead of launch:

  • Leverage Steemit platform/users by creating articles on Particl dev team bringing Confidential Transactions, RingCT, voting and governance to bitcoin’s codebase and how that is good for all. Tag using #particl
  • Reddit/Twitter/Bitcointalk posts that get word out about Particl’s upcoming privacy features, significance of privacy in anticipation of marketplace, significance of choice of privacy (RingCT or CT)
  • Articles on Particl staking, passive income opportunities by running a node, especially when marketplace starts getting used around the world.
  • Get Involved. As the project is getting closer to mainnet the team is looking for more community growth and participation opportunities. This could be helping with our social channels (twitter, reddit, etc), creating a development community for Particl, creating a writing community and gathering graphic, design orientated individuals to help with promotions, marketing and PR.

As we near the end of our wait I ask you to hold strong and prepare for world domination.

Thank you,

Particl Team

node.plaintext:
Particl Foundation Update — 2 week delay
The Particl Foundation formation has progressed significantly since our previous
updates with the final documents from the Particl team being proofed to fulfill
our obligations. We have, however, received some unfortunate news that will
affect the release date of Particl Mainnet which is out of our control.

We are proposing a new Particl Mainnet release date of 30th June, this adds an
additional two weeks to the well anticipated release of mid-June. Unfortunately,
the Swiss Government requires an additional two weeks to review and approve the
Particl Foundation paperwork. This is regretful as it pushes our eight week
projection from the end of exchange to ten weeks. We wanted to get this update
out to our contributors as soon as we found out and sincerely apologize for the
two week extension.

Rest assured, our aim is to release Particl Mainnet to the community at the
earliest opportunity however there are certain obligations around the formation
of the Particl Foundation which we cannot compromise on therefore please keep in
mind that June 30th could still shift if we run into any issues with our
Foundation documents and/or we don’t have a significant amount of Particl
wallets created from our contributors in preparation for PART token
distribution.

Particl wallet generation — Snapshot
Congratulations to all of you who logged into Particl.io [https://particl.io] 
and finished the requirements in your dashboard portal. If you have yet to set
up your Particl wallet please take 10 minutes to login to your account and
walk-through the latest changes. We’ve set up a couple guides to help you.

 * Guide: How to Generate your Particl Wallet —
   https://particl.news/guide-how-to-generate-your-particl-exchange-passphrase-1fd78ba36fd1
 * Video Tutorial: How to generate Particl exchange passphrase —
   https://youtu.be/lSjLsCkabEk
 * Guide: How to Verify your Particl Wallet Recovery —
   https://medium.com/@rynomster/guide-how-to-verify-your-particl-wallet-recovery-7ef91d435a19

Current statistics:
 * 551 out of 1660 contributors have created their first PART address — 33%
 * 3,562,760 PART is linked to receiving addresses — 46.5%
 * 80,000 PART has been donated by contributors for Community Initiative #1
   [https://particl.news/a-community-driven-initiative-e26724100c3a]
 * 16,000 PART (20%) has been pledged by foundation as a match for this fund

> We applaud your generosity and encourage everyone to continue to give 25% or
greater of your free bonus as we establish a viable fund for long-term SDC
holders who missed the exchange window.
Particl Core Public Testnet
We are very excited to offer the first public glimpse of the Particl network on
our TESTNET 1. Enhancements to Bitcoin Core 0.14:

 * Confidential Transactions
 * Decentralized Voting
 * Donation Addresses

The Testnet is running at 5% staking reward at the moment. Let us know what you
think of it. The staking proposal on the table at this time is:

5% — Year 1
4% — Year 2
3% — Year 3
2% — Year 4 and beyond

Announcement:
+Particl Testnet — Getting Started
[https://paper.dropbox.com/doc/d9yhExvCaW6vCp3qLUwuW]

> NOTE : Only those who have completed their offline wallet generation by 10:00
UTC on Tuesday 6th will have Particl Balance on this Testnet (it will mirror 1:1
your Mainnet balance)

node.plaintext:
Saturday April 15th, 2017 marked the end of 4 amazing weeks that began in a
flurry of activity and never really let up; straight through the Holiday
weekend. 1658 PARTicipants showed up in force to emphatically give the Particl
team a green light for our open source, decentralized privacy platform built for
global person to person eCommerce.

Milestones 1, 2 & 3 are all 100% Funded!
Roughly 5,150,000 SDC
[https://chainz.cryptoid.info/sdc/address.dws?SUaqjDUwAuVKnmWUX5tgU3fK1PkmbdfVCD.htm] 
tokens were converted over the last 28 days, accounting for nearly 78% of all
SDC tokens on the network! We collected 590 BTC
[https://blockchain.info/address/3Dms5LZbkdiyyvZhaF2UzomyKDKtuXKBx7] to help us
smash all three of our funding Milestones which will insure continuous
development, research, hiring, code review and more.

The entire Particl team would like to extend their sincerest thanks to all who
participated. Thank you for all your donations and show of support in our
community channels. Without you, our dreams of creating a global, private person
to person privacy platform and marketplace would not have come true. The future
looks so bright for enabling buyers and sellers around the world to transact in
private, without limitations and to whomever they choose. We are so excited to
push forward and lead empowered by the support our token holders and community
behind us.

What is going to happen next?
The final numbers are still being finalized as the team works with some
participants to fix mis-allocated transfers and returning SDC and BTC that was
sent after the close of the funding round. We politely ask for a few days to
sort these out with all the parties involved and report back with a follow-up
article to Token Holders and next steps: Part 1
[https://particl.news/tokens-holders-and-next-steps-part-1-b9d7cd7e7887].

In the coming days, we’ll speak to the next steps our PART token holders need to
take to prepare for the Particl mainnet release and introduce our newest team
member as well as, profile a couple community members who followed the team over
to Particl and some of the initiatives they are creating within the Particl
community and all cryptocurrency communities who can use Particl.

Again, we would like to thank the community, investors and teammates for the
great support, tireless effort and courage to speak your mind that has made this
initial funding round for Particl a smashing success!

We are in a grass roots phase of growing the ecosystem with many community led
initiatives just beginning to blossom. Jump in
[https://www.reddit.com/r/Particl/wiki/community] where your passions lead you
and help grow Particl into the platform you want it to be.

Milestones 1, 2 & 3 are all 100% Funded!

Roughly 5,150,000 SDC tokens were converted over the last 28 days, accounting for nearly 78% of all SDC tokens on the network! We collected 590 BTC to help us smash all three of our funding Milestones which will insure continuous development, research, hiring, code review and more.

The entire Particl team would like to extend their sincerest thanks to all who participated. Thank you for all your donations and show of support in our community channels. Without you, our dreams of creating a global, private person to person privacy platform and marketplace would not have come true. The future looks so bright for enabling buyers and sellers around the world to transact in private, without limitations and to whomever they choose. We are so excited to push forward and lead empowered by the support our token holders and community behind us.

What is going to happen next?

The final numbers are still being finalized as the team works with some participants to fix mis-allocated transfers and returning SDC and BTC that was sent after the close of the funding round. We politely ask for a few days to sort these out with all the parties involved and report back with a follow-up article to Token Holders and next steps: Part 1.

In the coming days, we’ll speak to the next steps our PART token holders need to take to prepare for the Particl mainnet release and introduce our newest team member as well as, profile a couple community members who followed the team over to Particl and some of the initiatives they are creating within the Particl community and all cryptocurrency communities who can use Particl.

Again, we would like to thank the community, investors and teammates for the great support, tireless effort and courage to speak your mind that has made this initial funding round for Particl a smashing success!

We are in a grass roots phase of growing the ecosystem with many community led initiatives just beginning to blossom. Jump in where your passions lead you and help grow Particl into the platform you want it to be.

node.plaintext:
A long time ago, before anyone knew you could spell particle without the letter
“e”…

Knee deep in founding a startup when an opportunity presented itself,
As the Particl team was hard at work, around the clock, around the globe,
preparing our new project for the public we caught wind of a respected
crypto-investment duo researching privacy coins for an upcoming webcast series
called Profit Potentials In Privacy Coins™ After having a typical meeting to
discuss pros, cons, advantages, disadvantages of the technology the Particl team
had developed for Umbra we found out they were hoping a privacy coin project
would sponsor the series so they could go further into the “privacy buckets” and
provide the most thorough webcast series they had done to date.

If it benefits the community as a whole then it is worth doing right,
This was a perfect opportunity for the yet-to-be-revealed Particl platform to
provide something of value to the entire privacy ecosystem. An impartial review
of privacy coin projects, something educational, informative and of benefit to
seasoned investors or newcomers to the technology. Tai and Leon wanted this not
to be weighted to any particular project and we 100% agreed.

The Particl team approached the guys with the offer to sponsor their series,
provide office space to film the series and provide a professional AV crew to
shoot and edit the series. Tai and Leon agreed and immediately their research
buckets grew three fold; but that’s a good thing! The result was a collection of
videos that rank among the most watched videos in their collection of webcasts.

> We couldn’t be prouder to be part of this series and encourage anyone seeking an
in depth analysis on privacy coin projects Monero, DASH, Shadow Cash, Zcash,
etc… to check out the entire set of videos at 
http://cryptocurrency.market/category/profit-potentials-in-privacy-coins/
And behind curtain #1 we have….
Buzz around the mystery of the anonymous privacy project sponsor began shortly
after the first video was released. Particl had yet to be announced and we
didn’t want special treatment (just yet ;) ). A by-product of this collaboration
was a special series dedicated to Particl and geared toward investors. The
7-part series was the most in-depth coverage Cryptocurrency.Market has done to
date on a new startup and covered a wide range of topics:

node.html:
A long time ago, before anyone knew you could spell particle without the letter “e”…

Knee deep in founding a startup when an opportunity presented itself,

As the Particl team was hard at work, around the clock, around the globe, preparing our new project for the public we caught wind of a respected crypto-investment duo researching privacy coins for an upcoming webcast series called Profit Potentials In Privacy Coins™ After having a typical meeting to discuss pros, cons, advantages, disadvantages of the technology the Particl team had developed for Umbra we found out they were hoping a privacy coin project would sponsor the series so they could go further into the “privacy buckets” and provide the most thorough webcast series they had done to date.

If it benefits the community as a whole then it is worth doing right,

This was a perfect opportunity for the yet-to-be-revealed Particl platform to provide something of value to the entire privacy ecosystem. An impartial review of privacy coin projects, something educational, informative and of benefit to seasoned investors or newcomers to the technology. Tai and Leon wanted this not to be weighted to any particular project and we 100% agreed.

The Particl team approached the guys with the offer to sponsor their series, provide office space to film the series and provide a professional AV crew to shoot and edit the series. Tai and Leon agreed and immediately their research buckets grew three fold; but that’s a good thing! The result was a collection of videos that rank among the most watched videos in their collection of webcasts.

We couldn’t be prouder to be part of this series and encourage anyone seeking an in depth analysis on privacy coin projects Monero, DASH, Shadow Cash, Zcash, etc… to check out the entire set of videos at http://cryptocurrency.market/category/profit-potentials-in-privacy-coins/

And behind curtain #1 we have….

Buzz around the mystery of the anonymous privacy project sponsor began shortly after the first video was released. Particl had yet to be announced and we didn’t want special treatment (just yet ;) ). A by-product of this collaboration was a special series dedicated to Particl and geared toward investors. The 7-part series was the most in-depth coverage Cryptocurrency.Market has done to date on a new startup and covered a wide range of topics:

  • Introduction To Particl For Investors
  • Need & Necessity For The Particl Project
  • Value Of The Particl Project
  • The Particl Community
  • Money To Fund The Particl Development
  • Getting Attention & Adoption For Particl
  • Risks Of Investing In Particl
The series “Particl (PART) For Investors” can be found at http://cryptocurrency.market/category/cryptocurrencies/particl-part-for-investors/

Thank you Tai Zen & Leon Fu

The Particl Team wants to extend our sincerest appreciation and thanks for providing two in-depth series covering the privacy coin ecosystem with rigor, impartiality, integrity and class. Thank you for letting us be a part of the series and thank you for asking the hard questions when they needed to be asked. We hope you enjoyed the experience as much as we did.
